subject: Productivity
title: Gigerenzer and Simple Rules
description: A short lesson to help you apply Gigerenzer and Simple Rules.

hook.text: A doctor using one simple question diagnosed heart attacks better than a complex algorithm.

buildup.text: Gerd Gigerenzer argues that simple heuristics often outperform complex models in uncertain worlds.

discovery.text: His fast-and-frugal heuristics use minimal information. Less data, better decisions â€” counterintuitive but proven.

twist.text: Complex models overfit to noise. Simple rules focus on the one or two factors that actually matter.

climax.text: Gigerenzer's work shows that real-world intelligence isn't about more data. It's about the right data.

punchline.text: Sometimes less information makes smarter choices.

quiz.question: What does Gigerenzer argue about simple heuristics?
options: They often outperform complex models in uncertain environments
They always produce worse results than algorithms
They only work in laboratory settings
